   coumadin secondary to GI bleed,) dementia, bipolar disorder, and COPD
   who presented with profound anemia, found to have a large duodenal
   ulcer, and continued hematocrit drop despite epinephrine injections,
   now transfered for potential GDA embolization.
   .

   despite EGD injections of a large duodenal ulcer.  Abdominal exam shows
   no evidence of peritonitis, and no evidence of free air under the
   diagphram on CXR.  Given the size of the duodenal ulcer with ongoing
   bleeding, treatment plans could include a GDA embolization, repeat EGD,
